name: JavaScript 3/5
description: JavaScript 3/5 is the "old" version of JavaScript as currently supported by browsers (mostly JavaScript 5). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaScript. Good to be used directly on small projects where build tools and transpiling are overhead. We prefer the use of ES2015 and beyond and use Babel for transpiling so more modern an powerful JavaScript language features can be used.

name: ES2015+
description: The new version of JavaScript with way more powerful language constructs. See http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/ for the language specification. Not all browser support the new ES2015 features, so use Babel - https://babeljs.io/ - for transpiling. This means that the project requires a build system. https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/ gives  nice overview of the new ES2015 features

name: jQuery
description: Still a viable solution for small projects, and for example in combination with Bootstrap 3.x.

name: Bootstrap 3.x
description: Still the #1 library for web UI's, especially for administrative screens.

name: Full Stack devs
description: Don't be scared of install complete platform and edit Razor views
